text:
Yasam Lakshmi Narayana Reddy (second from right) , Director of DHTE, releases the e-proceedings at a conference in Puducherry on Thursday. Others in the picture are (from left) D. Govindarajulu, Principal of PEC; Nitin Arora, Senior Director of South Asia and Africa, Oracle Communications; Kyung-Tae Kim, Emeritus Professor of Hannam University, Republic of Korea; and R. Srinivasan, Principal Consultant, Oracle Systems Ltd., Dubai, UAE.Photo: S.S. Kumar

The rapid growth of communication in all spheres such as industries, banking and other sectors has necessitated the need for enhancement of security of applications to meet the rising challenges, said Nitin Arora, Director, Oracle Communications, (South Asia and Africa).

Speaking at an international conference on Communication and Security, he said all communication networks such as voice calls and Skype are open for any type of security breaches. The need for security was now increasing at a faster pace when compared with communication.

The three-day international conference is being organised by Electronics and Communication Engineering Department of Pondicherry Engineering College to mark the birth centenary of the renowned American scientist, Claude Elwood Shannon.

The conference was inaugurated by Yasam Lakshmi Narayana Reddy, Director of Higher and Technical Education.

D. Govindarajulu, principal of Pondicherry Engineering College, Kyung-Tae Kim, Emeritus Professor of Hannam University, Republic of Korea and R. Srinivasan, Principal Consultant, Oracle Systems Ltd, UAE participated.
title: Conference stresses on application security
